docs.text: well i'll be damned . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the canadians can make a good movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the world is coming to an end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we don't know why or how , but apparently there is no way to stop it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the world has had this information for months , as most of the rioting and other assorted chaos has passed and governments have shut down operations .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet for a handful of toronto citizens , life goes on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they aren't going crazy or attacking people in the streets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead they are simply preparing themselves for the end . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some engaging in activities they've always wanted to do , some gathering with family and friends , and others just seeking to be alone .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these people's lives however all intersect during their final six hours .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: writer-director-star don mckellar has crafted a highly unique and emotional film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all of the main characters are compelling as they try and do whatever it is they need to do on their last night on earth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: craig ( callum keith rennie ) tries to fulfill all his sexual fantasies , a gas company employee ( david cronenberg ) calls every customer letting them know the gas will be flowing until the very end and thanks them for their business , and patrick ( mckellar ) just wants to be by himself but isn't having much success .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even minor characters keep popping up where you least expect them to , tying everyone even closer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: things seemed a little hokey towards the beginning of the film , but ultimately everything comes together nicely ( although it's not a happy film . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some moments are understandably gut-wrenching ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the story is enhanced by some unexpected humor and very realistic performances , particularly from sandra oh , whose character is just trying to get home to her husband before the end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i have absolutely no problem that the reason for the end of the world is never given , nor does it bother me that the world is ending at exactly 12 midnight ( in toronto anyway ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but i do wonder why the sun never sets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: come midnight , the sun is still shining brightly .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maybe the sun is crashing into the earth . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: who knows .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: also , it's comforting to know that in mankind's final moments on the planet , people will still gang up on the street for the sheer purpose of pushing over a car or a bus ( that's not a shot at this film mind you . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i know people are just stupid and truly would be out in the street tipping over cars ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: last night is available on dvd from universal home video .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it contains the film in fullscreen format and includes the original theatrical trailer .
docs.label: positive
